page.description: Specify any Google visualization libraries that you want to load.

section.description: The *[ui:Google visualization libraries]* property lets you include Google's Visualization Libraries for creating charts in your UX Component. The libraries you specify will be dynamically loaded when the UX Component is loaded. To include visualization libraries, click the [...] button to open the *[ui:Select Google Visualization Libraries to Load]* dialog.
section.note: It is no longer necessary to go to the Web Project Properties dialog to specify that the Google JSAPI library should be loaded. The Visualization libraries are now loaded automatically by the UX as needed.

figure.title: The Select Google Visualization Libraries to Load dialog.

section.description: The available libraries are listed below:

item.name: corechart
item.description: For creating Area, Classic Bar, Bubble, Candlestick, Column, Combo, Diff, Donut, Histogram, Interval, Line, Pie, Scatter, Stepped Tree, Trendline, and Waterfall charts.

item.name: bar
item.description: For creating more complex Bar and Column Charts, including Material Bar, Material Column, Dual-X, Dual-Y, and Top-X Charts.

section.description: To learn more about Google's Visualization Libraries, visit the *[extlink:Google Charts@https://developers.google.com/chart/interactive/docs/]* documentation.
